revisionDesc.change: Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Proofreading corrections; derive new date and add note; Mattie's 17 February letter, Louisa's gift box to Hannah, chloroform lineman, neuralgia and rheumatism, and "folks" as Steers family.
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)

body.p: my letter is rather late this week i waited thinking i should have some word either from mattyMatty or hannaHannah but i have no word from either georgeGeorge had a letter from jeffJeff the other day he said mattyMatty was writing to mother but i have not received any as to han i dont don't expect any i thought when the box went maybee maybe she would write a few lines i requested her particularly to write if only a few lines and that we would expect her to come this spring but i have not heard nothing since heydeHeyde wrote they got the box) sometimes i get so worried about her that it makes me quite unhappy

i was sorry walterWalter you have them bad spells with your head it must be very bad indeed) there is a kind of linementlineament called cloroform chloroform linementlineament it dont don't affect one in the least that is to stupefy stupify but it is thought to be good for the neuralghy neuralgia and rheumatism i got a 50 cent bottle and am rubbing my knee and hand with it whether it will doo do me any good or not i cant can't tell yet i am pretty well now full as well as usual) georgeGeorge has got a bad cold which has made him almost sick but he has gone out to day he is not at work just now but has been) it is snowing at present like winter it thundered and lightened last night and rained so we must take it as it comes we have just got
a ton of coal so we shant shan't freese freeze O waltWalt how many mornings i think of you when we have buckwheat cakes how i wish you had some) the folks here goes on just the same dont don't seem to mind the loss of their father much
my love to mrMr. and mrsMrs. oconorO'Connor
